p: In grapevine, for instance, autotetraploid rootstocks reduce the vigor of the scion compared with their parental diploid while maintaining Phylloxera resistance ( Motosugi et al., 2002). Polyploidy also increased berry size as well as concentration of sensory and bioactive compounds ( Acanda et al., 2015); moreover, the generation of triploids is also particularly interesting for the production of seedless table grapes.
